paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its variants, specifically focusing on the V30M variant in patients with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv amyloidosis).

individual_records.phenotype_details: limb ataxia, muscle weakness, cardiac failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patients included three males and three females, whereas the healthy individuals were six males.

functional_data.summary: The study shows that TTR aggregation is enhanced on EV membranes and that EVs promote cell deposition accompanied by TTR aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M variant is known to segregate with disease in families affected by ATTRv amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The study involved serum samples from patients diagnosed with ATTRv amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most common variant in the causative TTR gene is the p.Val50Met (Val30Met; V30M) variant.
In hereditary ATTRv amyloidosis, TTR gene variant forms amyloid, which is deposited in multiple organs.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
